1.title: Z06s for Everyone
1.plot: The Corvette is an automotive icon and the Z06 variants are world class sports cars. We gather three generations of the Z06 to discuss the changes, and find the perfect variant for any budget.

2.title: Cayman Generations
2.plot: The Mid-Engined Porsche Cayman is often overlooked because of the legendary 911, but offers better prices and a more balanced chassis. Join Todd and Paul as they drive all three of the Cayman generations, tracing the good and bad changes along the way.

3.title: Cheap Sports Cars
3.plot: Sports cars are often viewed as an expensive luxury. But, there are great dedicated sports cars available for around ten-thousand dollars. We gather three completely different cheap sports cars and discuss the convergence of depreciation, value, and fun.

4.title: Oh-Kei
4.plot: The Japanese Kei-class cars were never sold in the US. But now, many of the most beloved of these tiny cars is old enough to be imported. We pull two of the most famous Japanese city cars and see how they do on American roads.

5.title: Custom Icons
5.plot: Many collectors refine their classic cars into the best of old and new. We travel to Griot's Motors in Washington to drive cars from their custom collection. The result is a some of the best driving and most frustrating episodes we've ever made.

6.title: Upscale Upstart CUVs
6.plot: The 5-seat CUVs remains the most popular new-car purchase. As a result, every company makes a model that didn't exist until recently. We drive new models from Volvo and Jaguar to discuss the trend and the range of offerings.

7.title: Racing a Lemon
7.plot: The 24 hours of LeMons racing series is one of the cheapest ways into motor sports. We've done it before, but never in a cheap sports car. This sounded like a good idea, until it all goes wrong.

1.title: The Greatest Hits
1.plot: The guys gather some of their most-recommended cars, the Fiesta ST, the Subaru WRX, and the Scion FRS to see if the similarly priced Ecoboost Mustang should join the group.

2.title: The Best MX5
2.plot: For more than twenty five years and four generations, the Mazda MX-5 Miata has been a success. The guys drive the four back to back, discuss the differences, and pick a favorite.

3.title: Focus RS vs. All
3.plot: The Ford Focus RS is the latest entry into the much-loved world of AWD, rally inspired performance cars. We take the RS, VW Golf R, Subaru STI, and Mitsubishi Evo X to one of our favorite roads to find the best.

4.title: Budget Supercars
4.plot: The BMW M2 and the Cayman GTS represent relatively affordable alternatives to the larger and more expensive M3 and 911. Plus, they offer near super-car performance. Picking a favorite is a genuine challenge.

5.title: The Best Mustang
5.plot: When Todd and Paul drove the Mustang Boss 302 they declared their favorite Mustang ever. But now Ford has released the GT350 and reopened the discussion. Join the guys as they drive both back to back and talk about the changes.

6.title: Mid-Engines & Mountains
6.plot: Very few mid-engined cars are available, and most are extremely expensive. In celebration of the rare Alfa Romeo 4c and its rivals, the Porsche Cayman and Lotus Elise, the guys take all three on a road trip to some of California's greatest mountain roads.

7.title: Learn to Drift
7.plot: Over the years the guys have worked to learn car control and never let the car step out at speed. Drifting requires the opposite, so we spent a day at Drift101 learning how to control chaos.

8.title: Track Ready CUV?
8.plot: The small 5 seat CUV market is the fastest growing market segment, blurring the definition of SUV ever further. Using a Jeep Grand Cherokee for reference, we set out to see if the Mercedes GLA and Porsche Macan are cars or CUVs.

9.title: Alfa Giulia vs. M3
9.plot: The BMW M3 pioneered the high-performance Sports Sedan and has refined it over many generations. Alfa Romeo returns to the US sedan market with the Giulia Quadrifoglio, aimed directly at the latest M3. We put the upstart up against the king.

1.title: Affordable Sports Cars
1.plot: The Mazda MX5 is no longer the only affordable RWD sports car on sale. Paul and Todd drive the hardtop MX5-RF, the Fiat 124 Spider, and the revised Toyota 86 to debate which one offers the most for drivers.

2.title: Legends
2.plot: The 1980s BMW M3 and Porsche 911 have skyrocketed in value and become legends among car enthusiasts. Paul and Todd drive them back to back to find out what makes them special and which one they'd take home.

3.title: Lukewarm Hatches
3.plot: Commuting in city traffic doesn't mean a car can't be fun. Paul and Todd gather three do-it-all hatches and go in search of the best place to be in downtown stoplights and traffic.

4.title: Rivalry
4.plot: The Mustang and Camaro rivalry is as old as the muscle car scene. But, the current top models are designed for the street course more than the drag strip. Paul and Todd drive the Shelby GT350R and Camaro ZL1 to debate their huge performance and how this match-up has changed.

5.title: Lemonade: Amateur Racing
5.plot: Many drivers dream of driving in an endurance race like the famous 24 hours of LeMans. Luckily, many amateur series like the cheap car 24 hours of LeMons exist to allow a low-cost endurance experience. Paul and Todd join a LeMons team and try to live the dream.

6.title: California Adventure
6.plot: California offers some of the most iconic driving experiences in the world. We share the very best by taking a Corvette Z06 on Laguna Seca Raceway and down Pacific Coast Highway.

1.title: Electrics for Everyone
1.plot: The Tesla Model 3 is a hype machine, and its direct competitor, the Chevy Bolt, is barely known. We drive them both and discuss if your next car should be electric.

2.title: The Alternative
2.plot: Kia has introduced a new model into the shrinking RWD sedan market. The guys put the new Stinger GT against a BMW to see if the Korean automaker has created a worthwhile alternative.

3.title: King of the Hot Hatch
3.plot: The AWD Focus RS reinvigorated the Hot Hatch segment. But Honda has brought the Civic Type R to the US to challenge for the title.

4.title: Five Seat Phenoms
4.plot: The fastest selling cars in the US are small five-seat CUVs. The guys drive the Mazda CX5, Jeep Cherokee, and Subaru Crosstrek to find the best one for most people.

5.title: Stock or Resto-Mod
5.plot: Driving a showroom stock 68 mustang and a Frankenstein 67 Resto-mod, the guys debate all the ways to enjoy a classic muscle car.

6.title: Wrangler vs. Moab
6.plot: Jeep's new JL is the latest version of the iconic Wrangler. With a brand new Rubicon, the guys rock-crawl Moab and discover what's possible from the factory setup.

imdb.plot outline: A show of car comparisons and adventures for everyone. Paul and Todd have been reviewing cars for over a decade and believe the car you drive every day should be fun. Each week on Everyday Driver they seek out great affordable cars that can do all the boring chores of driving and still be thrilling on a back road. Fun to drive cars and great driving experiences, for everyone. On Everyday Driver.
imdb.title: Everyday Driver
plot: A show of car comparisons and adventures for everyone. Paul and Todd have been reviewing cars for over a decade and believe the car you drive every day should be fun. Each week on _Everyday Driver_ (qv) they seek out great affordable cars that can do all the boring chores of driving and still be thrilling on a back road.
